programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Sling Shot
programme.desc: Soviet Luna 3 was the first to use gravity to change course to photograph the dark side of the Moon. NASA Mariner 10 used the technique to swing by Venus to target Mercury. The gravity sling shot maneuver has become a standard for space navigation.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: From There to Here
programme.desc: The sky above is studded with stars and countless galaxies. In them, we can read not only our origin, but also our final destination. Technology is on the brink of taking us to places we have only dreamed of.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: Who are these people that venture into space? Once they were test pilots, then scientists and engineers now teachers, politicians and paying tourists what does it take to earn the astronaut wings?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Edge of the Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe, the further back in time we reach. Most of what we see is actually dark matter and dark energy, but its nature eludes us ... for the moment.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Living with Space
programme.desc: Astronauts and Cosmonauts train and study for years to work and live aboard the International Space Station. With this wealth of experience and insight behind them what do they think when they return to Earth?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Atmosphere
programme.desc: Our atmosphere is an unbelievably complex machine that protects us from the vacuum of space, shelters us from harmful radiation and allows us and the biosphere to breath; we need to learn much more about it so we can better it.

programme.title: Engineering Connections

programme.title: Megastructures

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to develop a hassle-free pizza recipe especially for the grill—one we hope will become a new backyard barbecue favorite.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Pork loin is delicious roasted in the oven, but it takes on a new character when cooked on the grill. The fire imparts a delicate smokiness to the meat, and the heat creates a handsome crust. French potato salad is a perfect counterpoint to the pork.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic—cornbread.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: If you're a fan of saucy barbecued chicken, you'll love pulled chicken. Similar to the more traditional pulled pork, it's simply tender shreds of smoky grilled chicken moistened with barbecue sauce.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Ashley shows Bridget how to tackle Texas-sized, Thick Cut Smoked Pork Chops. Then, Adam reveals his pick for dry measuring cups. Finally, Julia reveals the secret to achieving the perfect Backyard Barbecue Beans.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan teaches Julia how to make the perfect South Carolina Smoked Fresh Ham. Then, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of Spiral Sliced Hams. Adam reveals his pick for potato mashers. Finally, Christie shares a Smashed Potato Salad recipe with Bridget.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia grill up Sausage and Peppers. Then, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of whole-wheat sandwich bread. Next, Adam reviews disposable plates.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting—the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: German chocolate cake—filled with sticky pecans and coconut—is not without flaws. We set out to develop a German chocolate cake that avoids the common pitfalls and delivers on its promise.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to make a meatloaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish—skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dinners prepared entirely in one skillet are perfect for weeknight cooking. Less cleanup is one obvious benefit. A skillet also gives the cook a bit more control over cooking multiple elements.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Beef, beer, and onions have a natural affinity—it's one reason burgers and onion rings are often on bar menus. In a carbonnade, the beef melds with the soft sweetness of sliced onions in a lightly thickened broth that is rich, deep, and satisfying.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First, we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, but you don't need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that are a little too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to be able to serve English-style fish and chips—large pieces of moist and delicate cod in a crisp and tender coating with thick-cut fries—at home.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Commonly found at catered events, this once-highbrow dish has become a bit of a joke. But after preparing several cookbook versions, we realized that pairing a crisp-fried coating with a delicate butter sauce was a great idea that deserved a revival.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: While the hallmark of this filet mignon is its tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We love a good stir-fry served with rice, but a noodle cake, a savory round of tender noodles sautéed in a skillet until the exterior is crisp, is also a great base for a saucy stir-fry.
programme.sub-title: Stir-Fried Chicken with Crispy Noodle Cake

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We prepare a Thai-inspired beef stir-fry and share a recipe for great potstickers.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We create tasty versions of two Tex-Mex favorites: chicken fajitas and huevos rancheros.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Just when we think we've become familiar with every Italian dish under the sun, we're pleasantly surprised to come across one we've somehow overlooked—Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, steak Diane was prepared tableside and included a burst of pyrotechnics supplied by a match and some cognac. Sure, such theatrics might seem a bit dated and silly, but they are essential to the flavor of the dish. We explain why.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Most of us might not have time to prepare eggs during the week, but come the weekend, eggs are a terrific way to begin a leisurely day. In this episode, we take a look at a couple of our favorite egg dishes—scrambled eggs and omelets.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Delicate foods, such as shrimp, are trickier to cook over the grill's intense, dry heat. We wanted to find the best way to grill shrimp so that it ends up tender, moist, and flavorful.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Summertime entertaining can often mean preparing food for groups. If you're looking for a main course to serve a crowd or want to give a new twist to a summer vegetable, we offer recipes for tender beef brisket and savory corn fritters.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we show you how the strangest-sounding methods can sometimes be the most rewarding and how a few easy tricks can give an old standby, like roast chicken, a new lift.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie makes Bridget the ultimate Grilled Thick-Cut Porterhouse Steaks. Then, Adam shows Julia his top pick for paring knives. Next, Jack challenges Bridget to a tasting of crumbled blue cheese. Finally, Lan Lam makes Julia the best Caesar Green Beans.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan makes Julia a tender and delicious Texas Barbecue Brisket. Then, Adam shows Bridget his top pick of coolers.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Natalie prepares Cast Iron Baked Chicken with Bridget. Next, Jack challenges Julia to a tasting of hot sauce. Finally, Ashley shows Julia how to make foolproof Blueberry Cornbread with Honey Butter.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Our goals in this episode are twofold: create an old-fashioned chocolate layer cake with the same moist, tender crumb we so fondly remember from our childhoods and infuse it with true chocolate flavor.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: When it comes to apple desserts, apple pie may be the most popular, but it's also one of the most involved. Fortunately, when you don't want to fuss with pie but you still want that comforting combination of apple and pastry, there are other options.

programme.title: In the Heat of the Night
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier and Rod Steiger (who won a Best Actor Oscar® for his performance) shine in this classic mystery-thriller that took home five Academy Awards®, including Best Picture and Best Adapted Screenplay. Lee Grant and Warren Oates also star.

programme.title: Fist of Fury

programme.desc: Charles (John Heard) loves Laura (Mary Beth Hurt). And Laura loves Charles. But when she changes her mind and returns to her husband, Charles decides to win her back, aided – and occasionally hindered – by his mixed bag of quirky friends and family.

programme.desc: Things go awry when car salesman Jerry Lundegaard (William H. Macy) hires two thugs to kidnap his wife. Soon, the very pregnant and chipper Police Chief Marge Gunderson (Frances McDormand) takes the case. Is she up for the challenge? You betcha.

programme.desc: Lonely, 12-year-old Oskar is bullied by his classmates. A new friendship develops when Eli, a pale young girl who only comes out at night, moves in next door. Coinciding with her arrival is a series of inexplicable disappearances and murders.

programme.title: Destination Wild: Wild Madagascar

programme.title: CLYDESDALE: SAVING THE GREATEST HORSE
programme.desc: The Clydesdale horse - famed for its white-feathered feet and for hauling Budweiser beer – is in danger of dying out.

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise of Nature
programme.desc: The dry forest, which once covered the entire Pacific coast of Central America, now exists only as isolated "vestiges". In Costa Rica, however, it has been revived and even expanded thanks to the efforts of biologists and the local population.

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise of Nature
programme.desc: From the Corcovado National Park, described by National Geographic as "the most biodiverse site on the planet", researchers and conservationists follow the so-called "green corridors" in search of key species.

programme.title: Costa Rica: The Rise of Nature
programme.desc: Costa Rica is home to some of the richest marine ecosystems in the world. Biologists and conservationists have undertaken a real race against time to better understand marine ecosystems and protect them.

programme.title: Dancing on Icebergs

programme.title: Australia: Land Beyond Time
programme.desc: Stunning inside look at a land more like another planet than another country. Includes a rare natural event that happens only once every hundred years: the formation of a giant inland ocean out of nowhere in the middle of the harshest desert outback.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives, Hidden Places

programme.sub-title: Kaziranga National Park: India – Where Wild Things Roam

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives, Hidden Places

programme.sub-title: Khao Sok National Park: Thailand – Wild Lives of Khao Sok

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives, Hidden Places

programme.sub-title: Tun Sakaran Marine Park: Malaysia – Paradise Found

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives, Hidden Places

programme.sub-title: Aso-Kuju and Unzen-Amakusa National Parks: Japan – Under the Volcano

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives, Hidden Places

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The reigning champions Apollo mount their defence of the title. They face stiff competition from Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'N'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: It is the grand final and the teams must dodge the arena hazards and, in a menacing new twist, they can also hit the Arena Tyre to unleash the dreaded House Robots, allowing them to inflict maximum damage anywhere in the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The teams are Donald Thump, Behemoth, Sabretooth, Apollo, Apocalypse and The Swarm. Along the way they must dodge arena hazards, menacing house robots and the all-new Fog of War.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Returning champions Carbide mount their title defence against some of the toughest machines in the competition. They will have to fight through brutal group battles and nightmarish knockout rounds to make it to the heat final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Competing in this heat are: Apex, Vulture, Terrorhurtz, Track-Tion, Bucky the Robot and Rapid. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The fourth heat features an experienced roboteer fighting to secure his legacy, a new wave spinner and a powerful crusher. Competing through group battles for a place in the final are Iron-Awe 6, The Kegs, Tauron, Nuts 2, Concussion and Androne 4000.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This round determines which of the fighting machines makes it into the grand final, along with the final two robots to compete in the Ten Robot Rumble. Thor, Coyote, Expulsion, Hobgoblin, Push to Exit and Magnetar battle it out.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The illustrious grand final begins with the biggest battle in Robot Wars history. The second and third place robots from the heats will battle it out in a fight to the death to determine who will be the 6th and final robot in the grand final.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dogs enter the ring as they munch and crunch their way into victory. Some will let off steam while others sends out flames of destruction.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The competitors waste no time getting stuck into the fray in the four way melees, with one robot seemingly dominating the competition. The house robots may be a little rusty as a robot launches an attack.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Heat C welcomes back familiar faces in the arena, as former champions return with old tricks up their sleeves.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Sir Chromalot returns to the arena to take on seven other mean machines. Steve must raise its previous form to send others tumbling.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The robots battle it out to send the crowd wild and their competition to robot heaven. Plus, 259 proves to be a genuine top contender.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Both old and new contenders must endure and evade the traps in the arena, full of flippers and pits. Meanwhile, Demolition Man is on a mission.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Tornado proves to be a strong contender in the arena, while house robots test the strength of newbies and push their limit.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: To qualify as semifinalists, contenders must emerge from the hustle of the house robots and survive the dance of death.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The arena is full of the bizarre and the befuddled as contenders are axed, tossed, and crushed. Only the strongest will survive.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: One semifinalist goes through to the next round with only three spots left. House robots like Growler make things difficult as they attempt to thwart the challengers' quests for victory.

programme.title: Road to Ninja : Naruto the Movie
programme.desc: Naruto and his friends succeed in driving away the infamous Akatsuki, who have mysteriously returned from the dead, but afterwards, a strange masked figure appears before him!

programme.title: Project A-Ko
programme.desc: Superhuman high schooler, A-ko, must set aside her rivalry with her genius classmate, B-ko, to save earth from evil alien invaders.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 2: Plot of the Daitokuji Financial Group
programme.desc: Three weeks after the alien ship landing on Graviton City, A-ko and the gang go on summer vacation. Meanwhile, chaos breaks out when B-ko's father arms the local military with new mecha to attack the alien ship.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 3: Cinderella Rhapsody
programme.desc: While working part-time at a fast food joint, A-ko falls for the mysterious Kei. While B-ko happens to like him as well, both of them are unaware that C-ko is the apple of Kei's eyes.

programme.title: Project A-Ko 4: Final
programme.desc: While A-ko and B-ko's rivalry over Kei intensifies over a surprise marriage proposal, another alien fleet is headed on its way towards Earth.

programme.title: Giovanni's Island [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A dramatic yet heart-warming story of cross-cultural friendship among children in the aftermath of WWII, presented by Tokyo-based award-winning animation studio Production I.G. Based on true events.

programme.title: In This Corner Of The World [English-Language Version]
programme.desc: A spirited 18-year-old woman is married off to a man she barely knows and must soon adjust to the struggles of living in Hiroshima during World War II.

programme.title: Fatal Fury: Legend of the Hungry Wolf
programme.desc: Terry Bogard returns from 10 years of training to avenge his father's murder by entering the King of Fighters tournament.

programme.title: Fatal Fury 2: The New Battle
programme.desc: After losing to German warrior Wolfgang Krauser, legendary fighter Terry Bogard battles depression and alcoholism as he wanders the country. Will he face his demons head-on once again?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Movie
programme.desc: Heroic Yugi squares off against archrival Kaiba in an adventure even more dangerous when the imaginary monsters in their playing cards become ferociously real…and when an old evil enters the fray.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Bonds Beyond Time
programme.desc: It's a whole new deal! For the first time, Yugi, Jaden & Yusei are together in an all-new adventure!

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Push
programme.desc: Superhumans defy a government plot to harness and abuse their powers. Chris Evans and Dakota Fanning (the TWILIGHT films) team in a pulse-pounding paranormal thriller.

programme.title: The Way Back: The Way Back
programme.desc: A small band of convicts stage a daring escape from a World War II-era Siberian gulag, and embark on a treacherous journey across five countries in a race for freedom and survival.

programme.title: Cold Souls: Cold Souls
programme.desc: Paul is an actor who feels bogged down by his participation in a production of Chekov's play, Vanya.

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as Noah in the timeless story of courage, sacrifice, and hope. This visually stunning, action-adventure is hailed as "one of the most unforgettable Biblical epics ever put on film." *Richard Roeper, Chicago-Sun-Times

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Radio astronomer Zane Zaminsky believes he has picked up a cosmic noise that signals extraterrestrial intelligence. His desperate search for answers leads him to discover that aliens are already on Earth and in the process of preparing to take it over.

programme.title: Copycat
programme.desc: Holly Hunter is an ambitious cop who tries to draw the forensic psychologist out of her self-imposed exile to help catch a murderer who is copying work of other serial killers.

programme.title: Time Toys
programme.desc: A group of kids stumble upon a chest full of toys from the future. The discovery takes them on an adventure using their new-found toys to save their neighbourhood and the world from a maniacal madman. A fun, futuristic adventure for all the family.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
programme.desc: One of puppet-maker Geppetto's creations, a puppet called Pinocchio, magically comes to life. In order to become a real boy, Pinocchio must go on a daring adventure and learn valuable lessons.

programme.title: Knucklehead
programme.desc: After incurring a large debt with a local criminal ringleader, Eddie Sullivan creates a get-rich-quick scheme and enlists a gentle giant named Walter as his unwitting accomplice.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: When 7-year-old Albert's mother is suddenly killed in an auto accident, he and his imaginary French friend "Bogus" take up residence with his no-nonsense aunt Harriet.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: Mumbo Jumbo
programme.desc: Thomas Doubting stumbles upon a magical amulet which takes him on a mysterious journey to the island of Sinmouth. The locals believe he is 'Mumbo Jumbo' – an entity who will restore their fortunes and rescue the beautiful Princess Vanilla.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows - Original Movie
programme.desc: Toad, Rat, Mole and Badger follow animal etiquette in this version of Kenneth Grahame's classic, in stop-motion model animation.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bite Fight
programme.desc: It's the fifth week of the season and the entire fleet battle for the most successful fishing spots.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Mission: Fishin!
programme.desc: As Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fleet charges into the heart of the fishing season, it's a tight race for the coveted title of top-earning boat.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Latitude
programme.desc: It's almost halfway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and the Gloucester fleet has hit a lull in fishing.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle Royale
programme.desc: With the second half of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna fishing season now underway, competition amongst the Gloucester fleet intensifies when tuna become scarce.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Brotherly Shove
programme.desc: A new week calls for new techniques as the Gloucester Captains try unconventional methods to hook their next paycheck.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Blue Grit
programme.desc: Time is running out in the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and, this week, every boat in the Gloucester fleet is facing a different challenge.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Beta Kappa
programme.desc: The tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, know that they have to rely on each other to get the job done, but sometimes trusting the competition isn't such a good idea.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bad Blood
programme.desc: Three weeks left of bluefin tuna season, the Gloucester fleet is desperate to haul in a monster.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sharks and Recreation
programme.desc: With only three weeks left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the pressure begins to take a toll on the captains.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Mighty Bite
programme.desc: With only two weeks left in the fishing season and the price of blue fin tuna on the rise, the Gloucester captains race to bring in record hauls.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Reckoning
programme.desc: There is only one week of fishing left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and the Gloucester fleet is set for a final showdown in a bid to catch the last monster tuna of the year.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Head To Tail (Special)
programme.desc: It's a look back at the best moments from two seasons of Wicked Tuna, featuring the wildest catches and fiercest rivalries, plus a sneak peek at the upcoming third season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: First Blood
programme.desc: It's the first day of the new Bluefin tuna fishing season in Gloucester, Massachusetts, and every captain in the fleet wants to the land the coveted first tuna of the year.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Anchor Anger
programme.desc: The rivalry between captains Dave Carraro and Tyler McLaughlin intensifies, while other boats in the fleet push to bring new mates up tospeed in the North Atlantic Bluefin fishing season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Bluefin Beatdown
programme.desc: An old rivalry re- ignites after a fight at the dock between captains Tyler McLaughlin and Dave Carraro, of FV- tuna.com, while a crewmember fights to keep his job on the Hot Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Harpoon Hellraising
programme.desc: It's week four of the North Atlantic Blue Fin Tuna Season and oneveteran Gloucester captain has yet to catch his first fish, while two rival harpoon boats go head to head.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: It's week five of Gloucester's Bluefin tuna fishing season, and when a sudden storm engulfs the fleet, each captain must decide if the risk of staying out on the water is worth the reward.

programme.title: Bent Rods and Broken Hearts
programme.desc: It's week six of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season and the Gloucester fleet's underdogs struggle to turn around their seasons.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Maine Event, The
programme.desc: It's week seven of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, Gloucester captains must decide whether go where the fish are biting or take their chances fishing inshore.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Battle At Midway
programme.desc: It's week eight of the Atlantic bluefin tuna season, the midway point of fishing where crews either knuckle down and push hard, or crumble from the grind.

programme.desc: Two childhood best friends embark on a road trip back to their hometown after one of them learns he has inherited a large sum of money from his recently deceased estranged father.

programme.title: The Big Divorce

programme.title: You May Not Kiss The Bride
programme.desc: An unassuming pet photographer is thrown into serious action, adventure and romance when he's forced to marry a Croatian bride and spend his honeymoon at a remote tropical resort where she is kidnapped.

programme.title: Who Gets The Dog?
programme.desc: A couple going through a divorce squabble over custody of their beloved dog.

programme.title: Nine Lives
programme.desc: A stuffy businessman finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat.

programme.title: You May Not Kiss The Bride
programme.desc: An unassuming pet photographer is thrown into serious action, adventure and romance when he's forced to marry a Croatian bride and spend his honeymoon at a remote tropical resort where she is kidnapped.

programme.title: Hearts of Spring
programme.desc: A successful mommy blogger decides to re-enter the world of dating and discovers the man she has been falling for is the same man she has been sparring with online.

programme.title: Once Upon a Prince
programme.desc: Susanna gladly accepts help one day from handsome stranger Nate at her parents’ garden store in small-town Georgia.

programme.title: Love Unleashed
programme.desc: While hosting a puppy party, Hailey meets single father Ryan.

programme.title: Wedding Every Weekend
programme.desc: Nate and Brooke are going to the same four weddings, four weekends in a row. To avoid set-ups, they go together as 'wedding buddies'. But what starts as a friendship soon becomes deeper.

programme.title: Tulips in Spring
programme.desc: An interior designer must halt her work on a big project in order to return home and assist her injured father at her family's tulip farm in rural Washington state.

programme.title: Love is a Piece of Cake
programme.desc: Jessie Dale is a third generation baker who loves her cake shop more than anything in the world. When developers threaten to buy her building and force her out, she must do all she can to save her bakery.

programme.title: Mid-Love Crisis
programme.desc: On the eve of turning 50 and her daughters' nuptials, Mindy Quinn finds herself doing the most unexpected thing: rekindling a romance that ended thirty years ago.

programme.title: The Secrets of Bella Vista
programme.desc: When Tess inherits an apple orchard along with a half-sister she never met, she unravels the mystery of the family who abandoned her, ultimately finding a new understanding of herself.

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Inspiration
programme.desc: Emma's life plan is thrown off course when Paolo must return to Italy to take care of his father and she discovers a new passion for making art accessible to all.

programme.title: The Love Club: Sydney
programme.desc: Former star track athlete, Sydney is now a successful food blogger who still holds a flame for her college boyfriend whom she hasn’t seen in ten years… until now.

programme.title: Majestic Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas in the charming town of Briar Falls will be bittersweet this year when architect Nell goes back to her hometown having been given the job of turning the historic Majestic Playhouse into a modern multiplex.

programme.title: Must Love Christmas
programme.desc: Known for her Christmas-themed stories, a renowned romance novelist finds herself snowbound in the charming town of Cranberry Falls. She soon finds herself in an unexpected love triangle with her childhood crush and a determined reporter.

programme.title: Holiday Hearts
programme.desc: While planning an annual Christmas party, Peyton is forced together with Ben to care for a friend's daughter. While finding their Christmas spirit, will there be some romance along the way?

programme.title: The Rooftop Christmas Tree
programme.desc: It's Christmas and once again, Dale places a tree on his roof and ends up in court. No one in the small town knows why he continues the practice, but an idealistic attorney, is determined to keep him out of jail.

programme.title: The Most Colorful time of the Year
programme.desc: Ryan is a elementary school teacher, who learns that he is colorblind. Michelle, an optometrist and mother of one of his students, helps bring color into his life in time for the holidays.

programme.title: Royal Nanny
programme.desc: MI5 agent Claire goes undercover as the royal nanny, and must overcome the challenges of her assignment, like resisting the charms of Prince Colin while keeping the family safe at Christmas.

programme.title: Ghosts of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Ellie is told by a fortune teller that she must resolve her past and make amends with all of those she ghosted before Christmas and discovers love in the process.

programme.title: Boyfriends of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Leading up to Christmas, marketing executive, Lauren, is visited by the ghosts of four ex boyfriends. She must learn to open her heart or risk losing her best friend, Nate.

programme.title: When I Think of Christmas
programme.desc: Sara comes home for Christmas to help her mom move, reconnects with a past love, and makes a surprising discovery for a holiday they will all remember.

programme.title: The Santa Stakeout
programme.desc: Tanya is a police detective who is reluctantly partnered with fellow detective Ryan to solve a recent string of heists taking place during high-profile holiday parties around town. They go undercover as newlyweds...

programme.title: We Need a Little Christmas
programme.desc: Julie is juggling being a single mother to a grieving child and facing her first Christmas without her husband when she develops an unexpected friendship with a neighbor.

programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, rapper French Montana serves up some "Smack and Cheese," avoids dangerous "Gas Assassins," and learns the true meaning of "Beast Friends Forever."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Chanel and Sterling take a trip to "Injury Camp," watch things go "From Bad To Worse" and prove the existence of "Time Travelers."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Olympic snowboarder Sage Kotsenburg learns what it's like to be "Totally Slopeless," talks about some "Sochi Problems," and has a little fun with "Chatter Gas."

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling and Chanel celebrate the 100th episode of Ridiculousness by getting "Popcorned," trying not to catch "Heavy Leg Syndrome," and having some good old-fashioned "Redneck Good Times."

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness
programme.desc: On an all-new episode of Ridiculousness, Rob, Sterling, and Chanel find out why "White Men Can't Dread," witness the winged lawbreakers of "Bird Crimes," and take it to the next level with "Extremer Sports."

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Ridiculousness

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.desc: Butterflies surely are the most fancied species inside the insect world. Their beautiful colouring and their graceful flight appeal to everyone. There are close to 4000 types of Butterflies – today many of them are endangered due to the loss of their habitat.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.sub-title: Children of the Sun - Wild Bees
programme.desc: Most people associate honey producing insects with the name “BEE“. Few realize that there are over 560 different species of bees - most of them live their lives “busy as a bee“ but some “abuse“ other insects and others are even known to be murderers. The film “Wild Bees” shows the incredible diversity and the stunning adaptations of our “BEES” to various habitats and diverse living conditions. Fascinating fights, sensational performances, imposing structures and colorful individuals – the world of “Wild Bees” offers all of this and more.

programme.title: Mantises - Masters of Deception
programme.desc: They are killers. They kill with unbelievable precision. They fight Kung Fu style and are seen in Japan as a symbol of vigilance - the mantises. Their triangular head with its unique flexibility is conspicuous. Two overdimensioned eyes fixate the distance to their prey rapidly and three-dimensionally. The chest segment of the mantis is prolonged and equipped with spiny appendages that can spear their prey as fast as a jack knife. The mysterious aura that surrounds the praying mantis has a lot to do with the fact that they are rarely seen. They have adapted to their surroundings perfectly. No matter whether leaves, blossoms, tree bark, sandy floors or even orchids - the mantis adjusts to all environments.

programme.title: Follow Your Cat
programme.desc: Follow us while we follow cats on their hunting grounds for mice and birds. Experience the double life of your domestic tiger... she will lead you on adventures that you never thought were possible. With a behavioural scientist that specializes in cats and modern technology we follow the cat on their wanderings into the wild. She maps their routes, unveils their secret favourite places, chronicles their territorial conquests, and shows us the entertaining habits of this enigmatic creature.

programme.title: Dust And Stripes
programme.desc: In a never-ending quest for grass and water, the striped herds undertake an annual epic trek across the vast lunar landscape of the Kalahari’s Makgadikgadi Pans. Most of the year, the Makgadikgadi is an inhospitable wasteland of windswept, salt-encrusted pans. For the area’s water-dependent zebra, the Boteti River on the western edge of the pans is a dry-season lifeline. However, it is also a death trap, with lions waiting in ambush and crocodiles lurking in dark riverside caves.

programme.title: Namibia`s Desert Kingdom
programme.desc: Although the dunes are barren, the dry riverbeds show signs of growth. And out of the heat, vast shapes appear. A herd of desert elephants ambles along the dry riverbed sniffing the ground with their lazy trunks. These remarkable creatures can smell the water underground and know where to find it. An abandoned well attracts a troop of chacma baboons, followed by a small herd of oryx and springbok, and finally a group of jackals. None of them has seen the pride of desert lions lying in wait.

programme.title: Germany's Wild Birds
programme.desc: By monitoring ten interesting bird-watching locations, we document not only the silver herons in the Westerwald, but also the last great bustards in Havelland. Then there are the great crested grebes in their splendid plumages, shown building their nests and during courtship, in an area of extinct volcanoes: the Eiffel. Add to this, exotic wild birds and colorful parakeets, the newest members of the population in a park in Wiesbaden. We have resting migratory birds, ducks and waders on the west banks of the Steinhuder Lake. On the border to the Netherlands, in the moorlands near Münster, we find the only wild flamingos in Germany. Equally interesting are the fire geese, avocets and many birds of the coastal region not far from Hamburg harbor. At Federsee Lake in Upper Swabia, we observe the inhabitants of the extensive reed zones: bearded tits. Then we have the birds of fortune, the cranes, which interrupt their long journeys by resting on the Baltic coast. Last, but not least, in the Feldberg lake region we accompany the ranger on an exciting sea eagle excursion. With this film, you are invited to experience a journey through the wonderful world of birds.

programme.title: Cuckoo - The Enemy in My Nest
programme.desc: It’s no news that cuckoos are brood parasites: they lay their eggs into the nests of other bird species – a clever trick that spares the rearing of own offspring. Some even go as far as to kill the other chicks in the nest. But why do other parent birds let this happen? Are they too stupid? Too inept? Or simply clueless? Admittedly, cuckoo’s eggs do look deceptively genuine. But the cuckoo chick? Not even remotely! It quickly grows into a giant that looks nothing like its new family. So why don’t the adoptive parents notice the sham then? Until recently, the ornithologists’ theory was: the “victims” have yet to learn to counteract. Turns out: they may even profit from having strangers’ chicks in their nest! So is cuckoo’s behaviour a phenomenal trick or an evolutionary riddle?

programme.title: Beak & Brain - Genius Birds from Down Under
programme.desc: These child prodigies of the animal kingdom have feathers and beaks – and very special skills! The Keas of New Zealand are the only parrots that live in snowy mountain areas. They like testing their brains, solving puzzles and challenging tourists: they unscrew bottle-tops, dismantle windscreen wiper blades and tear open rucksacks. They seem so determined you’d think they have an understanding of physics and mechanics! Thousands of miles northwards, in New Caledonia, other birds have talent, too. Here bird expert Gavin Hunt discovered that crows are able to produce a whole set of tools, each designed for a particular purpose – the most intricate tool culture in the animal kingdom! These high flyers compete against each other: Keas vs Crows. What is the secret of their intelligence? It’s the ultimate avian I.Q. test, with some funny and surprising results.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. 'Deercam' allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but as intelligent and affectionate family animals.

programme.title: Unnatural Selection
programme.desc: The wings of cliff swallows in Nebraska are getting shorter – while female turtles in Chesapeake Bay are getting larger. On the Galapagos Islands, two species of finches are developing back into one. Increasing numbers of peregrine falcons are living in urban areas – and have adapted their behaviour: thanks to the city lights, they have learned to hunt at night.

programme.title: Wild Prairie Man
programme.desc: Located in the Northern Great Plains of Canada, Grasslands National Park has been a 20 year odyssey for wildlife photographer James R. Page. For James, critters are more interesting than people and he shares some of his iconic images and experiences from this endangered ecosystem. We showcase the parks wilderness that is dominated by prairie light and dark sky, the wildlife, prairie dogs, mesmerizing landscapes, and bisons. We immerse ourselves in the wild habitat of Grasslands National Park for over a year capturing some never before scenes in the Wild Prairie. James R. Page's connection to the land and the wildlife provides an unforgettable journey into the heart of this endangered ecosystem, while Park experts help us understand its complexity.

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: The Moor
programme.desc: Moors and peatlands are oases in the cultivated landscape of Central Europe.

programme.title: Children of the Sun
programme.desc: Butterflies surely are the most fancied species inside the insect world. Their beautiful colouring and their graceful flight appeal to everyone. There are close to 4000 types of Butterflies – today many of them are endangered due to the loss of their habitat.

programme.title: Europe's far North - Lofoten and the Arctic Ocean
programme.desc: Lofoten is the rugged archipelago in the Norwegian Arctic Ocean. Whoever arrives here is really at the end. Moskenes is the end of the line, and anyone who wants to go further needs a boat or a plane. The only way to get to the open sea is via the Maelstrom, which is quite dangerous. On the outermost headland, there are only a few ruins left. The last inhabitants are long gone, a supply was hardly possible. But fishermen are on the way, mainly to catch cod. And there is the coastal administration, which takes care of broken sea marks and lighthouses. A visit to one of the luxurious ships of the Hurtig Line is not to be missed. They shuttle off rough coasts on an eleven-day trip between the Russian border and southern Norway. A floating workplace for a wide variety of professions. The island of Andøya is not served by the Hurtiglinie. It lies too far out in the Atlantic. One of the most important observatories in Europe is located here. A young woman, Sandra Blindheim, is the boss. She is responsible for the large laser that delivers important information to scientists around the world. On clear winter nights, there is a wonderful panoramic view of the aurora borealis.

programme.title: Northern Woods
programme.desc: It is a musical film a a tributeto the Nordic forest: it shows its development from a primeval wood to a cultivated forest. Once populated by wild animals such as wolves, bears, eagles, deer and musk oxen, complex re-enactment-scenes shot by dollies and helicopters vividly depict the colonization of the forest by the Celts and Germans. But as time progressed, the northern forest has on numerous occasions fallen victim to environmental degradation and overexploitation. Several provisions were made to protect this wild beauty. The Helsinki resolution of 1993, which stipulated that the woods be used in a way and in a magnitude which guarantees their biological variety and productiveness and vitality, is but one measure put in place to secure the preservation of the natural gem. Time-lapse photography and breath-taking shots show our main protagonist – the woods – in its stunning glory. This beautiful wooded land, changes throughout the seasons. Our woodland is a world-renowned ecological jewel. It is famous, well-known and loved by tourists, forest economists, environmentalists, historians and intellectuals alike.

programme.title: Wild Holland - The Living Delta
programme.desc: The film celebrates the diverse natural heritage of the Dutch delta region while sketching the cultural context that has played such a vital part in shaping it. Using cutting edge cinematic techniques ranging from eagle’s eye aerial views to unprecedented underwater scenes, 'Wild Holland - The Living Delta' presents a portrait of this unique wetland area of Europe as never seen before, capturing it in an important moment of change - a time when new life is flooding back into the delta.

programme.title: Primeval New Zealand
programme.desc: Peter Elliott reveals new information about the origins New Zealands 'evolutionary mutants'.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: 320 million years ago, dragonflies and centipedes were human-sized, unlike today's tiny insects.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: New fossils in China reveal prehistoric feathered beasts and giant insects, including large dragonflies.

programme.title: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: China fossils show prehistoric mammals evolved 35 million years ago, with more diversity and abundance.

programme.title: Giant Sea Serpent, Meet The Myth
